structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS

law.catch_line: Powers of hearing board after public hearing.
law.text:
After a public hearing, the hearing board may:
Continue the suspension of a permit suspended by the air pollution control officer; or
Remove the suspension of an existing permit invoked by the air pollution control officer pending the furnishing by the permittee of the information, analyses, plans, and specifications required; or
Find that no violation exists and reinstate an existing permit; or
Revoke an existing permit, if it finds:
The permittee has failed to correct any conditions required by the air pollution control officer; or
A refusal of a permit would be justified; or
Fraud or deceit was employed in the obtaining of the permit; or
Any violation of this chapter or of any rule or regulation of the air pollution control board.
law.history: Created 1952 Ky. Acts ch. 53, sec. 60, effective March 14, 1952.
